title: Dan Isbell
text:
I am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Second Language Studies at the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa. I completed my PhD in Second Language Studies at Michigan State University in 2019 and previously earned an MA in Teaching English as a Second Language from Northern Arizona University. I am an Associate Editor at Language Learning and serve on the Editorial Board of Language Testing.
My primary area of expertise is language assessment. I frequently do research on second language speaking and maintain research interests in instructed second language acquisition and technology in language learning.






Interested in studying with me?



I am currently available to supervise PhD students. See PhD application details here.

I also teach courses and supervise MA capstone projects in language testing. See here for details on applying to our MA program.  
Contact me via email (disbell at hawaii dot edu) to discuss studying with me.
